Description: Part of the flat base and side from a marl pottery vase; handmade and decorated on the exterior in red-brown paint with remnants of oars from a boat, a skin on a pole flanked by two cabin motifs and remnants of a Naqada plant; a spiral is painted on the base.
Curator's comments: Decorated ware D41 series in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Published: G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 599
Condition: good (incomplete and fragmentary). some soot and salt damage
